settings.title: Our Shops
settings.content:
Paxton & Whitfield is a renowned cheese shop with a rich history. Established in 1742, we have four shops located in Jermyn Street, Chelsea, Canterbury, and Bath. Each shop offers a wide variety of cheeses and other gourmet products, and we are known for our exceptional customer service and expertise in all things cheese. All four shops have become iconic destinations for cheese lovers and food enthusiasts, attracting customers from all over the world.

If you'd like to join our teams, discover our job opportunities below.

settings.title: Our HQ
settings.content: Paxton & Whitfield's headquarters are located in the Cotswolds having relocated to a larger site in 2021. We have upgraded our cheese facility at the site to support the innovation and the artisan cheese industry, ensuring we can care for the cheese and house the maturation. Our dedicated Quality Manager and team carefully oversee all cheese at our HQ. Before reaching our customers and shops, the cheese is meticulously cared for to maintain its quality. Our site also houses our warehouse and offices, ensuring the seamless operation of Paxton & Whitfield.
Exciting job opportunities to work with Paxton & Whitfield. Discover more below!

settings.question: Cheesemonger
settings.answer:
Join Britain’s Oldest Cheesemonger:
Paxton & Whitfield has been the country's leading cheesemonger for over 225 years. Today we continue to deliver exceptional artisan cheese, fine food, and cheese experiences with unrivalled passion and expertise across our four UK retail stores.


We are looking for cheese enthusiasts to join our passionate and knowledgeable JGreen Street team. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to expand their career within the artisan food and/or cheese world.


This is a part-time role for between one to three days a week, although more shifts may be available on a week-to-week basis. Weekend availability necessary.


Key Responsibilities:


• Provide warm, informed and friendly customer service, whilst offering expert cheese recommendations


• Cut, wrap, weigh, and label cheese to the highest standard


• Maintain an attractive and well-stocked cheese counter


• Assist with stock rotation and merchandising responsibilities


• Support with occasional in-store tastings and events


• Maintain excellent shop hygiene and presentation standards at all times


What We’re Looking For:


• A genuine interest in cheese and artisan food


• Previous retail or food service experience (preferred but not essential)


• Friendly, enthusiastic, and professional manner


• Strong communication and customer service skills


• Willingness to learn and follow food hygiene procedures


• Availability to work weekends and busy seasonal periods


What We Offer:


• Comprehensive cheese training and opportunities to grow your knowledge


• Generous staff discount


• Be part of a proud British food heritage and a supportive, close-knit team

Salary - £12.25 per hour

To apply, please submit your CV to bath@paxtonandwhitfield.co.uk and a short cover letter telling us why you’d like to work with cheese.

settings.question: Seasonal Cheesemonger (Temporary Position)
settings.answer:
Job description

We're recruiting now for our busy Christmas season within a historic and innovative business based in our cheese maturing rooms in Bourton-on-the-Water, Gloucestershire.

The Role

We are looking for enthusiastic staff with great energy, a passion for food and attention to detail to work in our cheese maturing rooms.

The successful applicants will perform a varied number of cheesemonger duties, fulfilling our customer's orders and ensuring that our high quality standards are met at all times.

The role includes:

· Learn about cheese, tasting it daily to ensure that the highest standard of quality is met.

· Cut, wrap and label cheese’s ready for dispatch to our e-commerce, and wholesale customers.

· Assist in the maturation of cheeses within our state of the art cheese rooms.

· Ensure that all products are cared for in a manner consistent with our food safety and quality procedures.

· Regularly check cheese stock to ensure its quality is superb, act if any issues noted.

· Assist in carrying out accurate stock takes.

· Ensure all areas of the cheese rooms are always clean and tidy.

· Ensure all Food Safety procedures and Health & Safety policies are always carried out.

Previous work in a food environment is desirable, but an interest in cheese and a passion for food is essential.

Full on the job training will be provided.

Full & Part time positions available.

Weekend work will be required in December.

Please email your CV and a cover letter to: jazz.reeves@paxtonandwhitfield.co.uk
